author: jm
msg: annoyingly fix indentation to 2 spaces; allow up to 200 rules per .c file and yylexer tree; use function name prefixes so that multiple modules can be loaded at once without stepping in each others namespaces; use unsigned char as the type so that UTF-8 strings can be matched; allow multiple patterns to match per input line; remove a superfluous .c and .h file; put the scanner main function directly in the .xs file, and change it to return an array of the multiple keys that are hit; remove Exporter, since there's no need for these modules to fiddle with the main package; support quoted dblquotes and a few more chars in the pattern; allow fixup_re() to give up on an over-complex pattern without killing the entire script

author: jm
msg: import of Matt Sergeant's 're2xs' script, which uses re2c(1) to compile regexps into a fully-compiled, binary lexer XS module.  This has the potential to provide *insanely* fast rules -- which is nice.  Copied from http://www.sergeant.org/re2xs, via http://use.perl.org/~Matts/journal/30597

author: jm
msg: branch to try out Matt's incredibly cool re2xs work
This is an empty revision for padding.
